creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2013-08-16T17:02-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The photographs in this collection document stores, store fronts, street vendors, and various tradesmen such as butchers, bakers, and barbers in New York City, mostly in Manhattan.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to thirty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. See guidelines in Print Room for details.
This collection should be cited as Edwin Martin Photograph Collection, PR 096, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

Martin's photographic projects include "Postergirls," photos of public posters, "The Readers," photographs concerning the nature and activity of reading, and "Mud Show," which documents traveling circus shows. His proximity to New York City in the 1990s allowed him to focus on two different portfolios of photographs: "NYNY," and "NY Metier," which both highlight street vendors, storefronts, and street life.

The Edwin Martin Photograph Collection spans the period from 1994-2001 and contains images from the photographer's portfolios, "NYNY," and "NY Metier." The collection is divided into two series, after the portfolio titles. Photographs document New York City stores, storefronts, street vendors, and various tradesmen such as bakers, butchers, and barbers.

subject.value: Stores, Retail -- New York (State) -- New York
Street vendors -- New York (State) -- New York

dsc.value:
Series I: "NYNY" Scope and Contents note

Series I includes 61 11x14 silver gelatin prints from the portfolio of the same title. Photographs are arranged alphabetically after the photographer's title. Views show storefronts throughout the city, from Bergdorf Goodman to the Fulton Fish Market.

Photographs are arranged alphabetically according to the photographer's title. General locations of photographs are in brackets.

Series II includes 46 11x14 silver gelatin prints from the portfolio of the same title. Photographs are arranged alphabetically after the photographer's title. Several of these photographs show Zito's Bakery, on Bleecker Street, which closed in 2004.

Photographs are arranged alphabetically according to the photographer's title. General locations of photographs are in brackets.
